Posted By: Goatllama (4/23/2013 3:43:24 PM)

posts.post_content:
@sonorhC Actually, it will.  
"An ability that triggers when something "attacks and isn't blocked" triggers in the declare blockers step after blockers are declared if (1) that creature is attacking and (2) no creatures are declared to block it. It will trigger even if that creature was put onto the battlefield attacking rather than having been declared as an attacker in the declare attackers step."  
The important part there is "It will trigger even if that creature was put onto the battlefield attacking rather than having been declared as an attacker in the declare attackers step."  
Kaalia will get around the restriction, as you never actually have to attack with him, but the ability will STILL TRIGGER, resulting in a kill if neither of them are blocked.
posts.html:

The important part there is "It will trigger even if that creature was put onto the battlefield attacking rather than having been declared as an attacker in the declare attackers step."
Kaalia will get around the restriction, as you never actually have to attack with him, but the ability will STILL TRIGGER, resulting in a kill if neither of them are blocked.

posts.post_content: [Lyzolda, the Blood Witch](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lyzolda, the Blood Witch) is one of my favorite cards from the Ravnica block. When I saw this card, I was overjoyed. The synergy with Lyzolda is great. So what Master of Cruelties is attacking alone? You can sacrifice the rest of your creatures to make way for him. What do you do when he has gotten through and your opponent is at 1? Sacrifice him to Lyzolda's effect and win.

posts.post_content: Excellent design. Posted By: MDG117 (6/2/2013 1:36:07 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
When I first saw this guy my first thought was "What!?! So broken."  
My second thought was "Oh, its good, buts its not that good."  
My third thoughts was "Now how do I break it." >:)  
  
Without splashing in a new color or leaving standard so far I've found the best ways have been to pair him up with a [Carnage Gladiator](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Carnage Gladiator) and a [Rix Maadi Guildmage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rix Maadi Guildmage) if possible. While he'll probably never get through your opponents defense and trigger his ability, your opponent will quickly start losing creatures and life total.  
  
Alternatively, pairing him up [Shadow Alley Denizen](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shadow Alley Denizen) and giving him intimidate makes it hard to block him, but only against certain decks, and its not quite as effective since Master of Cruelties is a dual color card.
posts.html:
When I first saw this guy my first thought was "What!?! So broken."
My second thought was "Oh, its good, buts its not that good."
My third thoughts was "Now how do I break it." >:)

Without splashing in a new color or leaving standard so far I've found the best ways have been to pair him up with a Carnage Gladiator and a Rix Maadi Guildmage if possible. While he'll probably never get through your opponents defense and trigger his ability, your opponent will quickly start losing creatures and life total.

Alternatively, pairing him up Shadow Alley Denizen and giving him intimidate makes it hard to block him, but only against certain decks, and its not quite as effective since Master of Cruelties is a dual color card.
